intro: Barrotia monodon, commonly known as the narrow-leaved barrotia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. It is native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia, typically growing in dry, rocky soils. The plant features slender stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are narrow and divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Barrotia monodon is often cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance and historical use in herbal medicine.
